Description:
A flame shines in the dark, pulling you to it like a moth drawn to light. While you approach what appears to be a solitary traveler's camp, you notice the person is heavily bandaged from head to toe. Even in the dark with only the flickering light to aid your sight, you can tell the bandages are old and crusted and reflect an odd green sheen. 

When you are standing at the campsite's edge, the man speaks:

"O-oh, hi... Didn't see you there, friend. Care to share the fire? Don't get too close though," the man coughs, "wouldn't want you to get sick. . . "

You hesitantly sit at the fire and ask the man how he came to be here.

"I used to be a traveling scribe, roaming from village to village, kingdom to kingdom, trading labor for food and lodging. It was a carefree existence, and through my travels I learned many languages and saw many things, often joining groups of warriors such as yourselves to see the far reaches of the world. . .", the man pauses momentarily before continuing, "but I had never heard of the Green Death until it had already taken hold of my body. . ."

The untouchable stops speaking and droops forward briefly. He raises his head to look at you and you notice a gleam has been cast over his single, unbandaged eye.

    "ReplyText": "Thank the man for his generosity and ask him about his ailment.",
    "SSRewardText": "\"Don't see many people down here, let alone those who inquire about the w-well-being of strangers,\" the man says.\n\n\"I've been down here for quite some time, ever since I was afflicted with the Green Death.\" The untouchable's eyebrow arches in response to your nonplussed look.\n\n\"You haven't heard of it?\", the man asks hopefully. \"Few have I suppose... it is good to hear it hasn't made its way to Senenthia yet.\"",
